Articles.Content:
Hm I thought there was a sticky about how to install mods, but I couldn't find it. Anyway, generic instructions that I found, as well as instructions in mod readme files, tell me to extract to /gamedata: so if the archive contains /parts, /resources, etc, these folders are indeed supposed to be placed under /gamedata? Not in pre-existing /parts ie folders? RealFuels mod for an example has these /parts and /resources folders in the archive.

Edited September 3, 2014 by kurja

That information is now in the How to Get Support sticky. Item #2 under Troubleshooting. I think that section was moved during the support forums revamp last week.

Those rules should cover most mods, and the few that don't usually include more detailed installation instructions.

Basically, all the mod's folders (Parts, Resources, etc.) should go under GameData\ModNameHere. Make a folder with the name of the mod under GameData and throw all the mod's folders and files in there.
